title: Download Captions and Subtitles: VOD and Your Library

steps.title: Log in to Vimeo.
steps.content: Log in to Vimeo. To do so, go to https://vimeo.com in a web browser and log in using your email address and password or your Google account. Use this method to download captions for videos in your Vimeo library. These are videos that you or other team members have uploaded to your account.

steps.title: Click Library.
steps.content: Click Library . It's the first option in the menu bar to the left.

steps.title: Click a video to select it.
steps.content: Click a video to select it. You can select any video in your library you want to download the subtitles. If the original upload did not include a subtitle file, you'll need to pay an extra fee to have one created from Vimeo. However, if you subscribe to Vimeo Starter, Vimeo Standard, or Vimeo Advanced, you may not have to pay a fee.

steps.title: Click Subtitles and audio.
steps.content: Click Subtitles and audio . You'll see this menu option on the left side of the web browser.

steps.title: Click Subtitles or Transcript.
steps.content: Click Subtitles or Transcript . It's the first tab at the top of the "Subtitles and audio" menu. This displays options for "Closed captions."

steps.title: Click the Download icon .
steps.content: Click the Download icon . It's the icon that resembles a downward-pointing arrow above a line. If there is a subtitle file associated with this video, this will prompt you to download a subtitle file in the SRT format to your device. If you don't see a download option, make sure the Settings tab is active. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Log in to your Vimeo on Demand account.
steps.content: Log in to your Vimeo on Demand account. To do so, go to https://vimeo.com/ondemand and log in with the your email address and password or your Google account.

steps.title: Go to the VOD page for the video you want subtitles for.
steps.content: Go to the VOD page for the video you want subtitles for. Click the video on the Vimeo On Demand page to view its VOD page. Alternatively, you can hover over a video title in your "Purchased" list.

steps.title: Click the Download button .
steps.content: Click the Download button . This will download the video file along with any extra files.

steps.title: Select a video file and caption file.
steps.content: Select a video file and caption file. If the video has multiple formats, you can select the file format you want to download the video in. Then select the subtitle file format (usually SRT) that you want to download for the subtitles. This will download both files. If the video does not have a separate subtitle file, you can message the seller to see if you can get it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Why can't I download subtitles for a video?
steps.content: Why can't I download subtitles for a video? Not all Vimeo videos have subtitle downloads enabled. If you are unable to download subtitles for a specific video, you'll need to contact the video owner and request a subtitle file directly from them.

steps.title: Can I download embedded videos on Vimeo?
steps.content: Can I download embedded videos on Vimeo? You can only download videos that have the download feature enabled. If you don't see the download button, you can reach out to the video's owner to see if they will enable downloads.

steps.title: How do I message a video owner?
steps.content: How do I message a video owner? Go to the video's VOD page. Scroll down and click owner's username at the bottom. Click Message .

steps.title: How can I create subtitles for a video?
steps.content: How can I create subtitles for a video? You can create an SRT file using any text editing program, such as NotePad or TextEdit. You can use a free tool like Handbrake to embed the SRT file into a video . You can also use software to create subtitles for videos. Most require a subscription, but some are free or free with paid features. The following are some tools you can use to caption your videos: phttps://clideo.com/create-srt-file Clideo] - free or paid Rev - paid Amara Subtitling - free or paid GoTranscript - paid 3PlayMedia - paid Vitac - contact Vitac for payment options Scribie - paid

steps.title: How can I use an SRT file with a video?
steps.content: How can I use an SRT file with a video? You can use SRT files with a video using a media player, such as VLC Media Player , you can add the SRT file so you can watch the video and see its captions at the same time. Use the following steps to do so: Open the video in VLC. Click Subtitles . Select Add Subtitle File . Choose the subtitle file you downloaded. Click Open to add the subtitle file to the current video.

steps.title: Where can I get VLC player?
steps.content: Where can I get VLC player? You can download VLC for free at http://www.videolan.org/vlc/ .
